medical_history.chief_complaint: Delirium following complicated surgery for removal of a polyp of the colon.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms R developed acute confusion three days after surgery, followed by high fever and hypotension. Her confusion persisted throughout her 4-day ICU stay, revealing an anastomotic leak requiring diverting loop ileostomy. After her second surgery three months later, delirium developed immediately postoperatively, appearing confused and depressed in the following days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical history includes depression, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, irritable bowel syndrome, gastrointestinal bleeding due to diverticulosis, long-standing low-grade anemia, and a hip replacement in 2008.
medical_history.social_history: Ms R is a self-employed, active therapist who lives alone with children nearby. She does not smoke and does not abuse alcohol or other substances.
